name: Meta-Abstraction via Order Parameter Variance
description: The ability of the Meta-Controller to discover higher-order concepts (Meta-Linkers) by analyzing the statistical distribution of primary Meso-Linkers, specifically identifying phase transitions via peak susceptibility.
findings: By monitoring the variance of the Polarization Order Parameter (Susceptibility), the system autonomously identified the Critical Phase Transition point (Noise ~ 1.13).
The system discovered the concept of 'Criticality' without being explicitly programmed with the physics of phase transitions.
This validates the recursive nature of the NRM vNext architecture: L3 can abstract over L2 just as L2 abstracts over L1.
implications: The hierarchy of abstraction is potentially infinite.
Meta-Linkers can serve as 'Early Warning Signals' for systemic shifts.
This enables the system to navigate not just physical space, but 'Phase Space'.
